StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SaveShipperDischargeInforma.on]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @ID uniqueiden..er, @ShipperID int, @DrugsUsed varchar(100), @TrainingPhaseID int, @Platoon int, @DateRemoved date.me, @TrainingDay int, @DateReceived date.me, @LastEditBy varchar(200) ) AS BEGIN
BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF EXISTS(SELECT ID FROM [USMC].[Shipper_DischargeInforma.on] WHERE [ID] = @ID) BEGIN UPDATE [USMC].[Shipper_DischargeInforma.on] SET [ShipperID] = @ShipperID, [DrugsUsed] = @DrugsUsed, [TrainingPhaseID] = @TrainingPhaseID, [Platoon] = @Platoon, [DateRemoved] = @DateRemoved, [TrainingDay] = @TrainingDay, [DateReceived] = @DateReceived, [UPDATE_DATE] = GETDATE() WHERE [ID] = @ID END ELSE BEGIN INSERT INTO [USMC].[Shipper_DischargeInforma.on] ( [ID], [ShipperID], [DrugsUsed], [TrainingPhaseID], [Platoon], [DateRemoved], [TrainingDay], [DateReceived], [UPDATE_DATE] ) VALUES ( @ID, @ShipperID, @DrugsUsed, @TrainingPhaseID, @Platoon, @DateRemoved, @TrainingDay, @DateReceived, GETDATE() )
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully. COMMIT TRANSACTION END
